Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I see many zec forks that have plans to move to 144,5

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I don't think it's very smart, either. They seem to be doing it so they don't need to write their own optimized miners and can use existing miners that support common (N,K) values

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: the only thing that changing to the same KN values does is increase investment costs - profitability of ASICs with more RAM will not change

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: and the more that switch to the same K&N is the more likely that an ASIC for that K&N will come into being

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: or just put 4G of RAM in the damn thing and make K and N both a variable setting

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this very nice write up (but long) describes how Bitmain can most likely already follow forks with arbitrary (N,K), they probably use it for themselves already: https://blog.sia.tech/the-state-of-cryptocurrency-mining-538004a37f9b

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: On the ridiculous side, even if adding RAM drove the price of an ASIC up 10x, it'd still be more profitable than the same amount of USD spent on GPUs
